column4: my usb drive wont mount here is the dmesg and lsusb output how can i fix it? http://pastebin.com/4jsNTiZP
Have you tried mount /dev/sdb /some/mount/point ?
yes it says device doesnt exists
Does /dev/sdb1 exist?
it mounts in other linux distros and also windows
Does /dev/sdb1 exist?
no as i see. sudo fdisk -l wont give anything
Well if it mounts fine in another linux distro, you should probably file a bug
it suddenly happened i dont know why :S
It used to work?
yes still working in other distros
I mean in ubuntu
yes
Then you should file a bug report with all of this information
ok thank you
I see in dmesg it shows sdb1 and sdb4. Have you tried mounting these? mount /dev/sdb4 /mount/point
it says doesnt exist
Can you pastebin the output of 'ls /dev/sdb*'? (assuming you haven't unplugged it since pasting that dmesg output)
http://pastebin.com/G3ckinqL
That's strange if dmesg shows sdb1 and sdb4, they should exist in /dev/
Make sure the usb is firmly plugged and there's no short. Try a different usb port. Note that unplugging/replugging may cause it to show up on a different node such as sdc or sdd
tried nothing changed. :S also when i cat /proc/scsi/scsi it gives this http://pastebin.com/g1jSbwZJ
Weird. Make sure it works in the other distro or try a live session and file a bug report
ok i will try it thank you
